```{python}
#| label: treaty-impact-metrics
#| fig-cap: "What $27B Buys: Impact Metrics"

import sys
sys.path.insert(0, 'c:/code/decentralized-institutes-of-health')

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from brain.charts._chart_style import (
    setup_chart_style, add_watermark, clean_spines,
    COLOR_ACCENT, COLOR_MID, COLOR_DARK, COLOR_WHITE, COLOR_BG
)

# Setup styling
setup_chart_style(style='light', dpi=150)

# Data
metrics = ['Clinical\nTrials', 'Patients\nTreated', 'Lives\nSaved\nAnnually', 'Diseases\nCured\nYear 1']
values = [54000, 27000000, 180000, 15]
display_values = ['54,000', '27M', '180K', '10-20']

# Create chart
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(20, 10))
bars = ax.bar(metrics, values, color=[COLOR_ACCENT, COLOR_MID, COLOR_ACCENT, COLOR_MID],
              width=0.6, edgecolor=COLOR_WHITE, linewidth=3)

# Add value labels
for bar, display_val in zip(bars, display_values):
    height = bar.get_height()
    ax.text(bar.get_x() + bar.get_width()/2., height/2,
            display_val, ha='center', va='center', fontsize=56, weight='bold', color=COLOR_WHITE)

ax.set_ylim(0, max(values) * 1.1)
ax.tick_params(axis='x', labelsize=32, colors=COLOR_DARK)
ax.set_yticks([])
clean_spines(ax, ['top', 'right', 'left'])

# Add branding
add_watermark(fig)

# Don't use tight_layout - it overrides margins
plt.savefig('assets/charts/treaty-impact-metrics.png', dpi=150, bbox_inches=None, facecolor=COLOR_BG)
plt.show()
```

**Key Insight:** The $27B annual investment from the 1% Treaty funds **54,000 clinical trials**, treats **27 million patients**, saves **180,000 lives annually**, and could cure **10-20 diseases in year one**.
